position: Strategic Student Program: Software Engineering Intern (MFE; Spring 2022; SISW-PLM)
description:
Siemens Digital Industries Software Strategic Student Program (SSP) Discover your career with us at Siemens Software! We are a leading global software company dedicated to the world of product lifecycle management; from computer aided design, to 3D modeling and simulation- helping innovative global manufacturers design better products, faster! With the resources of a large company, and the energy of a software start-up, we have fun together while creating a world class software portfolio.

Our culture encourages creativity, welcomes fresh thinking and focuses on growth, so our people, our business, and our customers can achieve their full potential. We're currently recruiting students for our Spring 2022 Strategic Student Program. Our intern and co-op positions will allow you to find a career path that most inspires you.

Here, you will apply your education to solve real-world problems, and turn theory into practice. At Siemens, our goal is to empower our students to become the next leaders of our company. We have positions available in software development, user experience, data management, technical marketing, engineering consulting, and research & design innovation.

More information on our specific roles are included in this document. Baseline Requirements: Currently enrolled as an undergraduate student Minimum 3.0 GPA Authorized to work in the United States without the need for current or future sponsorship by the company Available to work in a part-time capacity (10-25 hours / week) and full-time in summer 2022 Preferred junior or senior status Perks: Victorious daily ping pong tournaments Paid volunteer time off Employee discounts at our top customer sites Networking with our global leaders Mentorship from senior engineers Individual career development planning Professional and technical workshops Energetic student community Leadership opportunities Potential for full time offers after university graduation and completion of the program Manufacturing Engineering Software (MFE) Software Engineer Intern Our NX CAM business unit, is developing the next generation of Manufacturing solutions. As a part of executing this vision, we are building automated toolpath generation systems that help our customers intuitively machine parts.

We are also working on improving the usability of the NX CAM software. NX CAM Toolpath generation software is used to drive CNC (Computer Numeric Control) machines. We are looking for a highly motivated and driven intern to help support our automation, tool path generation and architectural initiatives and develop prototypes.

You will be working in a lean-agile environment. Responsibilities and duties: Design, develop, modify and maintain the NX CAM Software Conduct research, design, prototype, and other exploration activities, as necessary Create and test the constituents of the features Test the solutions being created and/or evolved Collaborate with and support the Product Owner to create and refine user stories and acceptance tests Estimate the size and complexity of work Use pairing and other practices for frequent review Build Quality into all work/activities Continuously communicate/share to align expectations and to support a transparent and safe environment When coding, design and implementation best practices should be used to build high-quality components and solutions Equal to all others in the team, such that everyone's voice is heard. Self-organizing to benefit from the expertise within the team, whilst sharing/spreading that knowledge for the future benefit of the team Own, with the rest of the team, how the work gets done Organizational Requirements: GPA of a 3.0 or higher Experience in C/C++ programming, preferably in the Microsoft Visual Studio environment Eligible to work in the U.S.

without current or future sponsorship from the company Majoring in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or related field Strong oral and written communications skills You get high fives if: You have experience working with CAD/CAM software (preferably NX) You have experience working effectively and collaborating in a diverse team You have Software development experience in agile environments (preferably SAFe) You have experience writing multi-threaded code You have a working knowledge of Machine Learning techniques You have development experience in Python or HTML and CSS Organization: Digital Industries Company: Siemens Industry Software Inc. Experience Level: Student (Not Yet Graduated) Job Type: Part-time temporary Equal Employment Opportunity Statement Siemens is an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer encouraging diversity in the workplace. Job Description: This Intern will be invited to work part-time remotely during the academic year and full-time during the 2022 summer.

This Intern position will work within the Plant Process Control group and will afford the opportunity to apply educational experiences to real world industrial applications. Experiences are offered that encompass both existing system maintenance / enhancements, as well as ground up design, development and installation of new systems and processes, focused on productivity and quality improvements. Strong mentoring by seasoned Control Engineers ensures a mutually beneficial work experience.

Under supervised direction, the primary responsibilities include developing, testing, debugging, documenting, and maintaining software applications for use in the production environment. These applications are based on the client/server technology. A typical process application today, supports one or more user interfaces, connects to one or more database servers, and communicates with one or more process data servers. The role includes the design and development of database systems, user interfaces, process algorithms, reusable software modules, communications servers, and application specific code. The operating systems and tools utilized in this effort include OpenVMS, Windows, PLC's, DCS's, RDB, MS SQL, Oracle, Wonderware, OSISoft PI, Intellutions iFix, C language, .NET languages, FORTRAN, and PLC block and ladder logic. The successful candidate will be expected to take part in a cross functional team of management information systems, process control, and operations personnel in the development of a computer integrated manufacturing environment.

Requirements:
Candidates must be a full-time student pursuing a Bachelor's Degree or Master's Degree in Computer Science, Computer Management & Information Systems, Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering, or other IT related discipline. .
Candidates must be a current student and have completed their sophomore year by June 2021 and be in good academic standing.
Minimum 3.0 GPA
Be authorized to work in the US without sponsorship

Job Title: Research & Development Intern

Department: Quality and R&D

Reports to: Supervisor

Job Type: Hourly, Part - Time

The ideal candidate will possess and live by Mercer Foods core values.

CONTINUOUS IMPROVEMENT ● ACCOUNTABILITY ● INTEGRITY ● PERSONAL GROWTH AND WELLNESS ●

TEAMWORK ● WORK – LIFE BALANCE

The Research & Development Intern will assist in handling raw material, developing and maintaining the raw material and finished product specifications, maintaining work instructions, updating and maintaining drying ramp profiles, researching shelf life of the frozen and freeze-dried products, resolving drying related quality, production, and efficiency problems. Other duties as assigned.

COMPETENCIES:

Living Mercer Values Demonstrates the characteristics and behaviors of an individual who is living Mercer's values. Mercer's values are accountability, continuous improvement, integrity, personal growth and wellness, teamwork, and work-life balance.

Attendance Attendance is essential in demonstrating dependability. A reliable team member is on time for all scheduled shifts and is present as scheduled. Any team member with two or more active steps of discipline for attendance does not meet expectations of position.

Performance Demonstrates the skills and abilities to perform his or her job. Any team member with two or more active steps of discipline for any combination of disciplinary actions does not meet expectations of position.

Safety Good judgement is demonstrated at all times to maintain a safe work environment. Any team member with two or more active steps of discipline for safety related incidents does not meet expectations of position.

Training Current training is an indication of job preparedness from a safety, job skills, and food safety perspective. An employee that has completed all training expectations throughout the year as it pertains to his or her job requirements demonstrates that he or she meets the expectations of his or her position. A person that has past due trainings does not meet the expectations of his or her position.

SKILLS:

Attention to Detail Completes tasks efficiently and accurately while paying close attention to detail.

Communication Possesses strong communication skills and can explain complex concepts in ways everyone can understand. Is often seen as having strong interpersonal skills.

Compliance Ensure compliance with Federal and State laws and regulations, and corporate policies/processes.

Documentation Maintain proper documentation and records.

Individual Contributor Must be highly motivated and able to work independently

Integrity Maintain highest integrity with regard to the Company’s policies, procedures, practices, and data.

Microsoft Office Ability to use all MS applications such as Excel, Power Point, Outlook and Word.

Priorities Identifying and aligning priorities with business vision, mission, and values while achieving objectives.

Quality Standards Must be able to understand quality standards, methods, and reporting as required.

Relationships Works with all teams to maintain effective relationships.

System Management Manage data systems, to include developing and monitoring data entry, maintenance, tracking, reporting, and output.

REQUIREMENTS: B.S in Food Science preferred. The position will require basic math, reading, and writing skills. Experience utilizing lab equipment in a food production environment (educational lab work is acceptable). Demonstrated ability to communicate orally and in written form effectively with co-workers and customers. Must have computer operation systems knowledge and expertise.

FOOD SAFETY REQUIREMENTS:

• Place high priority on food safety, quality, and sanitation by understanding and executing Mercer Food’s food safety and sanitation policies and procedures.

• Hold self and others accountable to Mercer Foods food safety & sanitation guidelines and policies by communicating any food safety incident, observation, or opportunity to your leadership team or teammates.

• In the absence of QC Manager or QA Senior Manager, serves as back up to ensure all food safety, quality objectives and SQF system requirements are met.

WORK ENVIRONMENT: The usual and customary methods of performing the job's functions require the following physical demands: occasional lifting, carrying, pushing, and/or pulling; occasional stooping, kneeling, crouching, and/or crawling; and frequent fine finger dexterity. Generally, the job requires the following percentages of time committed to physical activity: 50% or more sitting, 20% or more walking, and 20% or more standing. The job is performed under occasional temperature variations and in a food manufacturing production environment. This position requires the ability to travel internationally on an occasional basis. Unrestricted visual and audio abilities are required for the safety of all employees. The ability to lift to 40 lbs. is required.



Part time role working 4 hour shifts, 5 days a week. Days and hours are flexible.

position: Intern - Asset Management, Preservation Equity Fund
description:
WNC seeks an Intern for up to 30 hours per week to support the growing Asset Management team in Preservation Equity Fund (PEF). PEF is dedicated to preserving affordable housing through acquisition of existing apartment communities while in return, providing cash flow and appreciation to its investors. The Asset Management Intern will directly report to and assist the Director of Asset Management. The ideal candidate enjoys working with a team and has the desire to learn.

Position Responsibilities:

Financial Statement Review: Review monthly financials for inconsistencies/errors, enter financials into proprietary database, and ensure proper income and expense allocation.

Budget Variance: Review annual budget and compare management company budgets to underwriting projections. Enter budgets into proprietary database.

Data Entry: Gather property specific information and enter data into proprietary database.

Capital Improvements: Track progress and budgets for various projects.

Ad Hoc Analysis: Complete various ad hoc reports and tasks for Preservation Equity Fund Team.

Qualifications:

Positive attitude and willingness to contribute to a team.

Must have the ability to multi-task and work in a fast-paced environment.

Strong computer skills and thorough knowledge of MS Excel & Power Point.

Proficient oral and written communication skills.

Professional and courteous.

Education & Experience:

Preferred areas of study for this internship are business, accounting, finance, or real estate.
